title: Decentralized Reckoning
outcome: Free zone councils launch a grassroots justice initiative, turning city squares into forums for testimony and repair as local archives resurface. Council loyalists disrupt the process, spreading misinformation and exploiting mistrust. Out of the confusion, new networks of trust and skepticism form, fundamentally changing relationships between citizens and power. Moral ambiguity runs deep as everyone’s records, loyalties, and motives are questioned.

events.description: Free zone councils launch citywide Truth and Repairs Assemblies, inviting personal testimonies about BCI harm. Old public squares fill with citizens sharing stories and reviewing evidence.
Council loyalists attempt to disrupt assemblies by submitting falsified confessions and contradictory records. Protesters demand real accountability and standardized review of claims.
Archives from 2022 and 2023 resurface, containing inconsistent behavioral flags and partial records. Council officials struggle to regain narrative control and block damaging disclosures.
Neighborhood review teams adapt archival heuristics to validate testimonies, crosschecking multiple sources and building lists of verified victims and abusers.
Out of the chaos, citywide trust networks form—some deeply skeptical, others highly supportive—reshaping social and political alliances across Stenograd.
